author: mratsim
content:
yes, and so those algorithms are not applicable.

You can use this one for 256-bit ops, it's constant time, it can be modified to exit early when b == 1 for variable-time inversion: https://github.com/mratsim/constantine/blob/f1cb2de0bdb347104f05d8cf3ad392281324f9f8/constantine/arithmetic/limbs_generic_modular.nim#L51-L77
But addition chains will be faster: https://github.com/mratsim/constantine/blob/f1cb2de0bdb347104f05d8cf3ad392281324f9f8/constantine/arithmetic/finite_fields_inversion.nim#L356-L495

There is still over 5x difference compared to Bernstein-Yang. https://github.com/mratsim/constantine/pull/172
